question: 100 g of ice at $0^{\circ}C$ is mixed with 100 g of water at $100^{\circ}C$. The final temperature of the mixture is [Take $L_{f}=3.36\times10^{5}J~kg^{-1}$ and $S_{w}=4.2\times10^{3}J~kg^{-1}k^{-1}]$
explanation: Heat to melt 100g ice: 33600 J. Heat from 100g water cooling to 0: 42000 J.
